title: NIH Human Virome Program Governance Structure
description: The organizational structure and governance mechanisms of the NIH Human Virome Program.

governance.name: HVP Steering Committee
governance.description: Main governing body for all HVP initiatives
governance.members: PDs/PIs from each award, NIH Program Officials, NIH Project Scientists, NIH HVP Working Group

governance.name: Executive Committee
governance.meeting: Formed at first Steering Committee meeting
governance.members: Two PD/PI chairs (from different projects), key project personnel, key NIH officials

governance.name: Consortium Organization and Data Collaboration Center (CODCC)
governance.description: Coordination hub for administrative activities and data management

governance.name: Scientific Working Groups
governance.description: Focused on specific research areas and collaborative projects

governance.name: Annual HVP Investigator Meetings
governance.description: Full consortium gathering for research presentations and collaboration

collaboration.name: HVP Data Portal
collaboration.description: Central repository for all virome data and tools
collaboration.implementation: Managed by CODCC, integrates with Common Fund Data Ecosystem

collaboration.name: Human Virome Reference Dataset
collaboration.implementation: Compiled by CODCC from all VCC contributions

collaboration.name: Collaborative Pilot Projects (CPPs)
collaboration.description: Cross-center studies for new tools, methods, and discoveries
collaboration.implementation: $250,000/year set aside by VCCs for years 3-5

collaboration.name: Standardized Protocols
collaboration.description: Common methods for sample collection, processing, and analysis

collaboration.name: Confidentiality Disclosure Agreement
collaboration.description: Protection of unpublished data and intellectual property

collaboration.name: Inter-Consortium Workshops
collaboration.description: Focused meetings on specific research challenges
